availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alvin O. Pattee (Kentucky butcher and soldier)

body.p: Kentucky butcher and soldier. Maine native. Son of Azalee W. Pattee. Married to Eliza Evans in Campbell County, Kentucky on October 30, 1858. Butcher in Campbell County, Kentucky in 1860. Father of George N. Pattee. Served in the 23rd Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st Lieutenant from May 28, 1863 to July 25, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Maine, Somerset County, Smithfield, p. 77B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 477.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Campbell County Marriages, Film #000465411, p. 159.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 134.
Case Files of Approved Pension Applications of Widows and Other Veterans of the Army and Navy Who Served Mainly in the Civil War and the War With Spain, compiled 1861-1934NARA Catalog ID 300020, Record Group 15, Roll WC116535-WC115474.
Find A Grave, "Sgt. Alvan Osborn Pattee (1838-1865)," Memorial #13549933, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13549933 (accessed August 5, 2020).
